arts.ttl: West Bromwich Albion 2-2 Sheffield United: Blades Secure Point To Go Top Of The League
arts.sum: Sheffield United earned a valuable point in a 2-2 draw against West Bromwich Albion to send them back to the top of the Championship. The Blades had to come from behind when Torbjorn Heggem steered the home side ahead on 25 minutes from a corner. arts.ttl: Sheffield United back on top but West Brom’s Fellows denies them win
arts.sum: Sheffield United returned to the top of the Championship but had to settle for a point as Tom Fellows’s second-half equaliser secured for West Brom a 2-2 draw at The Hawthorns. United moved a point ahead of Leeds as they extended their unbeaten run to eight matches, while the home side drew for the 10th time in 11 games. Torbjørn Heggem nodded in his first goal of the season to give West Brom a deserved lead, but the visitors turned the game around with two goals inside 98 seconds courtesy of Callum O’Hare and Tyrese Campbell to take a half-time lead. Continue reading...

arts.sum: This Sunday, the Hawthorns will host a fascinating clash as seventh-placed West Bromwich Albion take on second-placed Sheffield United. West Brom enter this game on the back of a frustrating run of results. Three consecutive draws have extended their run to nine draws in their last ten games. arts.ttl: West Brom vs Sheffield United predictions: Blades’ injuries offer Baggies a chance
arts.sum: Promotion hopefuls West Brom and Sheffield United face off in the Championship on Sunday and Aaron Rogan feels that an entertaining game with goals at both ends is on the cards.

arts.ttl: There is a lot right about West Brom under Carlos Corberan
arts.sum: Most supporters only see their team’s home games, so Baggies fans have only witnessed four goals in total with two of those coming in the same match. Albion’s home form is their biggest problem with only four goals scored in eight games, with five of those ending in draws and four finishing goalless.
